affiliations.affiliation: The National Institute of Occupational Health in Norway

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"526qj","text":"M9 minimal media is a highly-referenced microbial growth medium used for the cultivation of E. coli. This buffered minimal microbial medium contains only salts and nitrogen, so it is traditionally supplemented with glucose, amino acids and vitamins as needed.\nM9 Minimal Medium is suitable for non-selective cultivation of Escherichia coli strains for cloning, DNA plasmid production and production of recombinant proteins. It is also suitable for selective cultivation when appropriate antibiotics are added.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":334,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bovod","text":"Suitable for non-selective cultivation of E. coli strains for cloning, DNA plasmid production and production of recombinant proteins. Also suitable for selective cultivation when appropriate antibiotics are added.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bmnhe","text":"Prepare enough for the necessary number of experiments to perform in order to prevent batch-to-batch variation between experiments. Input chemicals should be of a certain quality in order to prevent contaminants that can impact microbial growth and selection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: M9 minimal medium, e. coli, Escherichia coli, bacteria, autotrophic medium

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"2pglj","text":"Be sure to wear appropriate PPE when working with antibiotics and chemicals. Take care when working with hot flasks and tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
